languageKey.label: SAV JpGraph > Query
Query object
<query [attribute]> ... </query>
Creates a query object.

Attribute: . id="myQuery". Optional attribute but it is requested when using reference to this object. The reference will be "myQuery".
The following tags are allowed inside the query tag.
<select>... </select>
Defines the SELECT clause. See the tutorial for an example.
<from> ... </from>
Defines the FROM clause. See the tutorial for an example.
<where> ... </where>
Defines the WHERE clause. See the tutorial for an example. You can use reference in < where >. For example, ###marker#myMarker### will be replaced by the marker whose "id" is "myMarker".
<groupby> ... </groupby>
Defines the GROUP BY clause. See the tutorial for an example.
<orderby> ... </orderby>
Defines the ORDER BY clause.
<limit> ... </limit>
Defines the LIMIT clause.
<setQueryManager type="managerName" uid="integer" [marker1="definition" â€¦ markerN="definition"]/>

Defines an external query manager. Attributes: . type="managerName". The external query manager name is defined by means of this paramater (e.g. type="wfqbe"). . uid="integer". The integer is the uid of the record where the query is defined in the external query manager. . marker1 to markerN are optional attributes which can be used for marker subsitution in a query defined with the query manager. The definition can either be a reference to an existing maker, e.g. "marker#myMarker" or a direct definition, e.g. "myMarker#3". In the former case, the query marker ###myMarker### will be replaced by the marker whose "id" is "MyMarker" while in the latter case it will be replaced by 3.
See the section "Defining and using an external query manager" in the tutorial.
